item.title: Competitions | Deputies discussed “competitive negotiation”
item.description: The possibility of representatives of the Public Administration to negotiate directly the proposals of public tenders with the candidates was discussed yesterday in the 1st Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly. This news will be created by the public hiring proposal, approved in general on January 11 last year. According to the explanations of Ella Lei, president of the commission, the possibility of so-called “competitive negotiation” with candidates is a new feature of the law, but can only be used in three situations: when all public tender proposals are rejected, although without changing substantially the tender specifications, when the work is too complex, making it impossible to establish a previous price for the proposals, or when the nature of the work makes it impossible to fix a price in advance. According to the newspaper or Mun, the law proposal states that when the administration chooses to avoid the public tender, and calls for proposals to a certain number of companies, the consultation must be made at least five companies. However, Ella Law indicated that the deputies are concerned that the alleged “randomness” of the companies consulted is not guaranteed or result in a fair procedure, so this will be discussed with the executive.

item.title: Press | Sam Hou Fai stresses diversity and internationalization
item.description:

The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, considered that the media in Portuguese and English play a role as a link with the international community. The message was left during the traditional dinner offered to the media. The Government leader stated that he hopes that these bodies “will also continue to perform well as an international link, enhancing the advantages of linguistic, cultural and international ties, continuing to present to the outside world the uniqueness of Macau, resulting from the fusion of Eastern and Western cultures. ”. With this hope, the Government leader believes that the media will contribute to “elevating the role of Macau as a platform between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, as well as a platform for openness to the outside world at a higher level”. The chief executive also said he hoped that "the sector will continue to increase its development and to promote, along with the government, internationalization, so that Macao is more attractive and has a greater global influence." As such, Sam Hou Fai expects to transmit “abroad, through professional reports, the 'Macao Experiences' and the 'Wisdom of China', favoring better clarification and avoiding misunderstandings and bad interpretations of the foreigner, thus making the field in an important window of objective, rational and genuine exchange of oriental and western cultures ”. item.title: Cooperation | Sam Hou Fai wants more connections with Portuguese-speaking companies
item.description:
The Chief Executive defended the need for more cooperation between local companies and Portuguese -speaking countries. In a speech before the Portuguese consul and the delegates of the Macau Forum, Sam Hou Fai stressed the importance of the guidelines proposed by Xi Jinping during the visit to Macau
Macau and Portuguese-speaking countries must strengthen business cooperation. This was one of the main highlights of the Chief Executive's speech at the reception dinner for the consuls general in the Macao SAR and the delegates from Portuguese-speaking countries at Forum Macau. Sam Hou Fai called for the improvement of “various exchange and cooperation mechanisms” between Macau and Portuguese-speaking markets, to “comprehensively leverage exchange and cooperation at the private sector level”. “The delegations that come from your countries to visit Macau will always be warm,” said the government leader. Sam promised to support the travel of Lusophone delegations to mainland China, including the in-depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin and the great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Sam defended the need for “pragmatic cooperation (…) in different areas” and highlighted the importance of Forum Macau’s new action plan until 2027. In addition to the connection with Portuguese-speaking countries, the leader of the Macao SAR Government pointed to cooperation between Macau and Southeast Asian countries. Highlighting the friendly relationship between Macau and Portuguese-speaking countries and that the Macao SAR is the only region in the world that has Chinese and Portuguese as its official languages, Sam Hou Fai stressed the need to “boost joint development characterized by equality, cooperation and mutual benefits , comprehensively raising the level of Sino-Lusophone cooperation”. Close friends In a speech marked by multiple references to the “important speeches” of President Xi Jinping, which Sam Hou Fai points out as the key to opening a new phase of governance in the Macao SAR, the leader of the Executive says that “a new scenario of exchange and cooperation has been created ” between Portuguese-speaking and Southeast Asian countries, China and the Macao SAR. Regarding Southeast Asia, Sam Hou Fai highlighted the Philippines. “The Macao SAR and the countries of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines, which are geographically close, have close economic and commercial cooperation, with intense exchange of people and in the cultural area, being traditionally good neighbors and good partners.” The ruler stressed the “valuable contributions to the Macao socioeconomic development” of the Philippine community, which, according to the 2021 censuses, corresponded to about 5 percent of the total population of Macao, being the second largest community in the following region to the Chinese community ”. "This good base of traditional cooperation," as Sam Hou Fai categorized it, is a factor to "grasp new opportunities, explore more potential cooperation in all strands."

item.title: Continental Affairs Council warns of “possible risks” in Macau
item.description: Taiwan recommended to the population not to travel to Hong Kong or Macau during the Lunar New Year, due to "possible risks to safety." The Continental Council of Affairs (MAC) of Taiwan recalled that the travel alert to both territories remains at the “orange level”, the second highest level. The body responsible for relations with China justifies the warning “taking into account changes to the situation in Hong Kong and Macau and in response to local laws and regulations and law enforcement methods”. “Citizens are advised to avoid non-essential travel” to the two cities, including in transit, due to “possible risks to safety and individual rights”, added the MAC, in a statement. The Lunar New Year is the main party of Chinese families, equivalent to Christmas in Western countries, and this year in Taiwan includes a period of nine days of holidays between January 25 and February 2. MAC advised the population in advance in a database created for Taiwanese inland, Hong Kong or Macao and recalled that there are direct telephone lines to support citizens. Registers to rise Although not mandatory, the number of Taiwanese who registered to travel to Chinese territory between January and October 2024 increased by around 14 times compared to the previous year, according to data released by the organization in December. Registrations for Hong Kong and Macau “exceeded five times the total for the same period last year”, said the MAC. China "continued to adopt and change national security laws, which led to several incidents, involving arbitrary detention, arrest and interrogation of Taiwanese citizens in mainland China, Hong Kong and Macao," said the body. In September, MAC said that a director of the Taiwanese conglomerate Formosa Plastics had been under “border control” for 18 days, a type of measure that prevents him from leaving the country. Taiwan raised its travel alert level in mid-June and advised the population to avoid China, Hong Kong and Macau, after Beijing threatened to execute people considered “staunch defenders” of Taiwanese independence.

item.title: Watch out for the bags
item.description:
“Olha a mala…” was a song by fado singer Celeste Rodrigues. It became immensely popular. I remembered the song because last week suitcases were the main topic in the media. We all have a suitcase. Most people who travel by plane have a hold bag where they put their most varied belongings. We usually put clothes, shoes, hygiene products and souvenirs for family and friends inside. There are many women who, not realizing the risk, put some of their valuable jewelry in their travel bags. There are people who risk carrying amounts of money wrapped in silver paper. And there is drug trafficking in many of the hold suitcases under the most diverse disguises. The travel bag is essential as something very intimate and that accompanies us. Often the suitcase does not reach its destination and we have to wait several days for it to appear and there are also cases where some of the suitcases are never seen again. Airlines are obliged, in these cases, to compensate passengers who are left without bags. However, the products that belonged to us and that we really liked we never see again. This happens all over the world and almost every day in the most different airports. The suitcase in the airport carpet is completely identified by itself, due to its color and even the accessory linked to the handle with our name and our phone. By the way, I remembered a text by writer Yvette Vieira, who said: “I recently read news about an English tourist who threw herself to the sea on Madeira Island, allegedly to go after a cruise ship where she would be The husband, the wife was rescued from the sea waters by three young people who decided to go to fishing that same night and one of the details that caught my attention throughout this Rocambolesque story was that the lady in question was able to maintain the surface in cold waters of the Atlantic, thanks to its suitcase. And that last fact did not surprise me, because it is under what circumstances is a woman never drops her suitcase. Which leads me to the theme I want to explore, women and their bags. In this world there are two types of portfolios, those who use large bags and women who prefer small sizes. I belong to the first group, because my whole life is concentrated in my suitcase. I'm that type of woman who, in an emergency, can pull out of her suitcase, as if it were a magician's hat, all kinds of things, from band-aids, ointments, writing paper, water, pills for a headache, etc, etc. , think about anything and that object is probably in the contents of my suitcase. Furthermore, I have a friend who had among her personal belongings a screwdriver that had been forgotten in her suitcase and had been with her for almost a year. And I'm not kidding! Not to mention the moms' bags, which are veritable warehouses of paraphernalia that would leave your jaw dropping. But why does a woman feel the need to have everything in her wallet? I don't know. I would like to have a logical explanation for such almost insane behavior, which involves kilos of belongings transported daily with long-term consequences for our bone structure, in my case I can only say that I don't like being caught off guard.” For the case is really, not being caught off guard. We don't run out of a suitcase where we are like that we like very much and that we are particularly disliked if we lose them. It turned out that the news fell like a bomb about the theft allegedly practiced by a party deputy arrives. The same party that does not stop talking about crime and that criminals must all be arrested. For, the Azorian deputy of the arrival was under the eye of the authorities since November last year, due to an anonymous complaint, that he stole bags that did not belong to him from the rugs of the airports of Lisbon and Ponta Delgada. Authorities this time confirmed through video-vigilance images that the deputy took bags that allegedly did not belong to him. Searches were searched for their Lisbon and Azores homes, resulting in suspicion of even stealing bags from other passengers. It sounds like a caricature case, but it is not. According to the television commentator and lawyer Rogério Alves, if proving the robbery of suitcases will be a serious crime that can go to a sentence of eight years in prison. However, the deputy concerned Miguel Arruda, after being removed from arrival, shamefully decided to continue in Parliament as an unregistered deputy. Just imagine your suitcase disappearing from the plane hold. The loss of your belongings, the consequent heartbreak and even the damage caused by a mental flaw of someone who got used to carrying other people's bags and enjoying all the good things that those bags would have inside. Now, the act being carried out by a deputy of the Assembly of the Republic is something that not even the devil would have imagined possible. The final investigations and the latest judicial decision on the alleged luggage thefts by the Chega deputy are awaited. The most important thing is that fellow readers be careful with your bags…
P.S. - Kung Hei Fat Choi

item.title: Which path to follow?
item.description: At the end of last year, during the visit to Macau, to chair the inauguration of the new Chief Executive and to inspect Rae, President XI Jinping gave two speeches, highlighting the "three expectations" and the "four hopes" to Macao's future development. This month, several meetings were held to analyze the President's speeches, the most significant being the thematic seminar that took place in Beijing on the 9th, where Xia Baolong, the director of the Hong Kong and Macau Labor Office of the Committee Central of the Communist Party of China and the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office at the State Council, delivered important messages. But regardless of the activities and seminars held, the key to improving Macau's development is the action of the SAR Government. Although the integration of Macao and Hengqin is the goal to reach in the next 25 years, the Macao Peninsula, Taipa and Coloane are currently the areas under the direct jurisdiction of Rae de Macao. Hengqin, being an area for “improving the new trading, construction and joint management system and sharing results” between Guangdong and Macau, remains a cooperation zone in China that aims to facilitate the economic diversification of Macao to its official integration in the MSAR . In late October 2024, more than 16,000 Macao residents lived in the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin, but the vast majority still live in Macao. As the “Macao Consumer Grand Prix” ended in December last year, there were continued calls from residents for the resumption of the Electronic Consumption Benefits Plan to compensate for the rising cost of living. However, local stores, affected by increased consumption of residents in mainland China and the increase in rents of rentals, seek way to try to survive. Although tourists from the interior of China arrive in groups, and do young visitors flood the tourist attractions to take photos, what tangible benefits bring to small and medium -sized local companies? In addition to increasing close contact between residents and compatriots of China in public transport, which other economic benefits come from these tourists? The expectations and hopes for Macau of the national leader, President Xi, are genuine. If Macau performs well, it could become an exemplary model of the “One Country, Two Systems” principle, valuing the city and allowing it to stand out. As for the “three expectations” and “four hopes” highlighted by President Xi, I have a personal opinion. Macao, is a bridge that connects today Chinese culture and western culture and has established its position in the national development framework as "a center, a platform and a base." To contribute to the construction of the Great Bay, Macau's main task should be the safeguarding of its characteristics. Only this way can you have the opportunity to make a difference in the international scene. Being patriot and loving Macau are certainly the basic requirements for Macau recruit trained people. Those who grew up in the city would not want to see their resources exhausted. However, ideas vary from person to person, but as long as they do not endanger Macau's interests or pose a danger to the country, they should be seen as patriotic. There are sayings like “greatness comes from an open mind”, “he who listens to all parties gets a clear view of the situation” and “only when every drop of water is retained can a river be formed and from the confluence of rivers an ocean ”. In the Chinese classic “I Ching”, you can read “just as celestial bodies never lose energy while describing their orbits, we must also fight constantly for our improvement”, which means that nothing in the world is unchanging. To drive Macau towards the future, we need capable individuals and entrepreneurs. As for the adequate diversification of Macau's economy, the Guangdong-Macao In-depth Cooperation Zone in Hengqin will undoubtedly be an excellent platform. In Macau's current economic structure, with the diversification of “1 + 4” industries, the gaming sector plays a crucial role. In the future, it will be more important to redouble efforts to achieve the progressive development of other sectors, rather than reducing the scale of operations in the gaming sector in order to achieve adequate diversification of Macau's economy. With regard to improving the level of governance, it is essential to avoid “nepotism”, expand the “circles of friends” of the government team and encourage and support public monitoring of the Government's performance, so that there is efficient and effective governance. The reforms are the previous condition for opening and opening is the result of the reforms. Taking advantage of Macao's experience on internationalization allows the Government of Masters to help transform the great bay into a “open platform”. If the Government of the MSAR can protect the way of life of citizens they will not naturally have reasons for complaints. If the Government of the MSAR ensures employment, society will not fall into chaos. A fair and equitable society will certainly be peaceful!

item.title: Geogastronomy and Macau UNESCO Creative City in Gastronomy
item.description: “Geogostronomy Offers an Innovative Lens Through The Exploration of the Deep-Rooted Cultural Connections Between Food, Landscape and People. The Synergy of the Mix and Match From Different Areas Creates A Magical Creativity to Outstand the Taste of Memories Which Seated as the Greatest Piece of a Region. As part of the UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy in Macao, Lisbon Macau Aim to Bring Together the Tradition and Innovation of Food and Fun Places to Foster the Global Appreciation of Macao. ” Dr. Christine Hong Barbosa. Vice President of Marketing & Retail Development of Lisbon Geogastronomy is a term that merges geography and gastronomy, emphasizing the relationship between food culture and its geographic roots. This concept highlights how local ingredients, cooking methods and cultural influences converge to shape regional cuisines. By examining local cuisine, researchers and enthusiasts can gain insight into a community's history, culture and identity. Geogastronomy thus serves as a bridge that connects culinary practices to environmental and sociopolitical contexts. Macao, located on the southern coast of China, is a distinct example of geogostronomy in action. Its position as a Historical Trade Port and Culture Cauldron provides a unique scenario for its culinary evolution. The intricate mix of Portuguese and Chinese influences in Macanese cuisine shows how geography can influence food culture, leading to a diversified range of flavors, ingredients and cooking techniques. Macau's gastronomic scene is a vibrant tapestry woven from various cultural wires, particularly those of Chinese and Portuguese origin. The city has iconic dishes such as the Macaense curry, cod and the authentic cream pastels (which are not confused with the eggs that ask for the streets and that we will reveal how such a phenomenon), each reflecting its influences arose. unique historicals. The fusion of spices, aromatic herbs and cooking styles creates a distinct gastronomic identity. The use of seasonal and locally sourced ingredients highlights Macau's connection to its geographic environment, reinforcing the principles of geogastronomy. The historical context of Macau's gastronomy is remarkable. Portuguese colonization introduced new ingredients and culinary techniques that became part of Chinese food traditions. This cultural exchange resulted in a rich variety of dishes that combine the best of both worlds. For example, the use of cumin, curry powder and coconut milk reflects Portuguese culinary practices, while techniques such as wok frying signify traditional Chinese cooking methods. As a result, Macau cuisine has developed into a sophisticated blend, rather than being a mere amalgam of the cultures that influence it. Several influential personalities play a crucial role in shaping Macau's culinary scene. Notable chefs and restaurateurs have dedicated their efforts to preserving and innovating Macanese cuisine. Renowned Chefs António Neves Coelho and José Avillez are known for modernizing traditional Portuguese dishes while maintaining their authenticity. His approach serves as an example of how chefs can honor their culinary heritage while adapting to contemporary trends. They emphasize the use of local ingredients and the appreciation of traditional recipes. Through their initiatives, they promote the concept of geogastronomy as a method to preserve culinary heritage. Their work exemplifies the vital role that chefs and culinary professionals play within the creative city. The designation of “Macau as a UNESCO Creative City in Gastronomy” in 2017 further highlights the importance of culinary innovation and heritage. This recognition emphasizes the city's commitment to maintaining and promoting its rich culinary history while promoting a sustainable future. The program encourages collaboration between local chefs, artisans and academics, promoting a gastronomic culture that reflects Macau's mixed identity. The designation of “Macau as a UNESCO Creative City in Gastronomy” had a far-reaching impact on several facets of Macanese society, namely tourism and local economies, which slowed down during the Covid-19 pandemic and are beginning to revive. Lisboeta Macau, for example, has made a notable contribution with its official vision being “to be a themed Macau tourist destination that combines iconic landmarks from its collective memory with unique Sino-Portuguese culture to promote its unique cultural identity . Lisboeta Macau proudly aligns with the vision of Macau as a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy. Macau's rich cultural history, which combines Portuguese and Chinese influences, creates a unique and dynamic gastronomic landscape. Lisbonite Macau believes that this recognition as a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy not only celebrates the fusion of flavors and traditions, but also highlights the importance of preserving and innovating local food heritage. With a strong commitment to preserving Macanese heritage and promoting innovative culinary experiences, Lisboeta Macau takes advantage of the company's strengths to promote Macanese-Portuguese culture, supporting cross-border integration “Turismo+Gastronomia” through collaboration with the famous Chef Portuguese António Coelho at “Angela's Café and Lounge”, highlighting the fusion of Macau's Portuguese-Chinese heritage with traditional Portuguese cuisine, combining culinary techniques Portuguese classics with innovative creations to offer citizens and visitors a memorable gastronomic experience and contributing to Macau's growing reputation as a vibrant gastronomic hub, in line with its economic development, attracting food enthusiasts, tourists and industry professionals”. “Lisboeta Macau is committed to supporting the Macao SAR Government's strategy of promoting the tourism industry, consistently driving local economic growth through innovation and cross-border integration. Lisbon Macau's LINE FRIENDS themed restaurant “BROWN & FRIENDS CAFE & BISTRO” and Shanghai's famous crab brand “CEJERDARY” joined the 24th Macau Gastronomic Festival, introducing diverse local flavors to global tourists and highlighting the Macau's dynamic strengths as a vibrant platform as a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy. Furthermore, Lisboeta Macau intends to take advantage of the synergies of the “Macao Outdoor Show Space” to present the “LISBOETA NIGHT-the Night Market with More Macanese”, stimulating the economic development of the community and immersing visitors in a distinct mix of traditional culture and modern innovation, showing the essence of Macanese and Portuguese-inspired culture, further strengthening Macau's night-time economy. These collaborations help reinforce Macau’s position as a creative city that values ​​both culinary tradition and innovation, ensuring the long-term sustainability of its gastronomic scene, while promoting economic growth and cultural exchange.” Such a distinction, he positioned Macau as a global gastronomic destination, attracting gastronomy enthusiasts and tourists eager for experiencing his unique culinary offers. The tourism sector benefited significantly with this designation. With the increase in international interest in the gastronomy of Macao, several festivals and gastronomic events were organized to present local dishes. These events not only celebrate gastronomic culture, but also offer entrepreneurs and platform companies to show their products. This increase in tourism translates into an increase in economic opportunities for local inhabitants, including the creation of employment in the sectors of hospitality, restoration and homemade food production or almost, weigh the crisis that Macau lives with the low purchasing power of residents that It decreased to the detriment of the continent and the tourist from there that it has reduced equally for the same reasons. In addition, UNESCO's designation leads the government to sponsor initiatives designed to support sustainable practices in the gastronomy sector. Programs that encourage cuisine without waste demonstrate a commitment to sustainability and community involvement. This paradigm change reflects a growing awareness of the interconnections between gastronomy, environmental management and social responsibility. Culinary education is another critical aspect of Macau's gastronomic narrative. Teaching institutions and cooking schools that should be created urgently not only reserved for the University of Tourism will play a key role in the formation of the next generation of bosses and cooking professionals. As they integrate the traditional Macanese cuisine in their curricula, these institutions foster the appreciation of the local gastronomic culture among students. This educational approach also encourages innovation, as young chefs experiment with their heritage, breathing new life into traditional recipes. Cultural preservation is fundamental to maintaining Macau's rich culinary history. Initiatives aimed at documenting traditional recipes and cooking techniques through oral histories and publications ensure these culinary traditions are safeguarded for future generations. The role of grassroots organizations and community projects focused on culinary heritage reflects the collaborative spirit of geogastronomy, in which local communities actively engage in preserving their unique food cultures. Despite the positive impacts of its designation by UNESCO, Macau's gastronomic sector faces challenges that deserve attention. A significant concern is the potential dilution of traditional practices due to globalization and mass tourism. With the proliferation of international restaurants and fast food chains, there is a risk that local culinary traditions are overshadowed, leading to a loss of cultural identity. In addition, Covid-19 pandemic had a serious impact on the sectors of hotel and tourism. Travel and restoration restrictions have forced many local companies to adapt quickly or risk closing. Although some establishments have adopted innovative approaches, such as delivery services and virtual cooking classes, others have struggled to survive in a difficult economic scenario. Another challenge lies in the balance between modernization and culinary authenticity. As heads experience melting kitchens and modern kitchen techniques, concerns may arise regarding the integrity of traditional dishes. Finding a balance between innovation and preservation will be essential to maintain the authenticity of Macanese cuisine. Looking to the future, several developments may emerge in the macao gastronomy sector. One of the predictable trends is the growing emphasis on sustainable practices. As consumers become increasingly aware of the environmental impact of their eating choices, Macao's restaurants and the likes can give priority to local and organic supply. This change promotes a sense of community and responsibility to the environment. In addition, technology is likely to remodel the culinary landscape. Advances in food production, preservation and distribution can provide growth and innovation opportunities. For example, using digital platforms can improve marketing efforts and reinforce connections between consumers and local producers. Innovations such as vertical agriculture and aquaponia can also offer sustainable solutions to supply ingredients in a densely populated city. Collaboration between culinary professionals, tourism authorities and the governments of Macau and Mainland provinces will play a crucial role in shaping the evolution of Macau's gastronomic identity. Joint initiatives aimed at promoting food culture, organizing workshops and showcasing local ingredients can raise the profile of Macanese cuisine on the global stage. These collaborative efforts promote community engagement and can mitigate the risks posed by globalization and the pandemic. The future of Macau's gastronomy looks promising, with a growing emphasis on sustainability and innovation. The collaborative spirit of geogastronomy can guide the city in navigating these challenges, ensuring that its rich culinary heritage endures as it adapts to a changing world.

item.title: Crafts | Exhibition and workshops showcase goldsmithing from Guizhou and Hebei
item.description:
“Brightness of Art - Gold and Silver Handicraft Exhibition of Hebei and Guizhou provinces” is the name of the Patent Show in the TAP Seac Gallery that displays artisanal goldsmiths of the Chinese provinces. In addition to the more than 160 pieces of gold and silver, the Cultural Institute challenges the public to know the craft practices of working the precious metals in workshops
The Tap Seac Gallery is exhibiting until the 23rd of February “Brilliance of Art – Exhibition of Gold and Silver Crafts from the Provinces of Hebei and Guizhou”, an exhibition that introduces the Macau public to traditional goldsmithing and crafts from the two Chinese provinces and the ancestral way of working gold and silver. Organized by the Cultural Institute, the exhibition is part of the Serpent Lunar New Year's celebration series, presenting “more than 160 pieces and joint joints and exquisite gold and silver articles”. The works “present sophisticated formats, a very high degree of technical refinement and a variety of styles. Inheriting traditional longtime techniques and incorporating a modern aesthetics, traditional arts radiate a contemporary aura, ”the IC describes in a statement. As the name of the exhibition indicates, the pieces are a reflection of filigree inlaid art and Chinese cloisonné art (a technique of applying thin strips of gold to metal surfaces, usually bronze) from Hebei Province. The exhibition also presents the jewelry of the Miao ethnic group from Guizhou province. Both cultural manifestations are on the National List of Items Representative of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of China.
Cultural gems The art of creating gold and silver pieces is a type of traditional Chinese crafts with over 3000 years of history. The IC indicates that the pieces of the art embedded in Filigree and Chinese art in Cloisonné de Hebei are characterized by a high degree of technical refinement, the diversity of their motives and their stunning ornamentation, having a great artistic value. In turn, the goldsmiths of the ethnic group Miao de Guizhou, denotes a multiplicity of cultural connotations, giving rise to works of markedly ethnic style, of excellent artistic taste. The Miao ethnic group is one of the largest in Mainland China, comprising around 56 dialects and ethnicities. The Miao live mainly in the mountainous regions of southern China. In addition to Guizhou province, the ethnic group is settled in areas in the provinces of Yunnan, Sichuan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangxi, Hainan and even Guangdong. Guided tours of the exhibition will also be available on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, with sessions in Cantonese scheduled for 3pm and in Mandarin for 4:15pm.
Learn from the master In addition to the exhibition, which can be visited free of charge from 10am to 7pm, including holidays, the IC will organize workshops in the Xian Xinghai Memorial Museum Room on Francisco Xavier Pereira Street, 151-153, in Macao. “In order to allow the public to have more direct contact with the gold and silver crafts on display”, the IC will organize four workshops on the 8th and 9th of February. On February 8th, from 10am to 12pm and 3pm to 5pm, an instructor will present techniques of Hebei filigree inlaid art. item.title: Architecture | USJ student wins award for best thesis project
item.description: Vera Vong, an architectural student at the University of São José (USJ), has just won the “Best Architecture Project in Asia”, obtaining the “D'Ouro Award” category in the competition “Arcasia Thesis of the Year (Toy) 2024 ”. At issue is the final degree project, entitled “Undulating Connections”, and with it, Vera Vong also won the special prizes for “Best [Project] in Innovation and Originality” and “Best in Global Orientation”. The award ceremony took place on January 16th. “Undulating Connections” is, according to a USJ statement, “a dynamic building that offers a specialized space for regional and global events”, being situated “in a geographical position” with a lot of meaning. “The design concept of the project is inspired by the light reflexes of Lake Nam Van, verified on the front of the building”, also verifying “the interaction of curved roofs, starting with a smooth angle, similar to a one mountain, and that creates an engaging space experience ”. Furthermore, the project for this building “has two exhibition rooms, an auditorium, two galleries, a public exhibition area, a café and a viewpoint”, being intended “for a 'networking' center, to support tourism, to encourage economic growth and increase intercultural interaction in Macau”, if it were built. Vera Vong's thesis project was selected, initially, by the Macau Architects Association to compete for the ARCASIA – Architects Regional Council Asia TOY Award.

item.title: Lunar New Year | What to see and do on the days of the celebration

item.title: Consumption | Casinos at the mercy of Chinese real estate and trust
item.description:
During the Lunar Year of the Snake, casino revenues will increase, but the level of growth divides analysts. The recovery of real estate and consumer confidence levels in Mainland China will be determining factors
Casino revenues could grow by up to 7 percent in the Lunar Year of the Snake, depending on the recovery of real estate and Chinese confidence, but will be far from the pre-pandemic peak, analysts told Lusa. “The biggest positive factor for Macau would be if the Chinese economy grew and consumer confidence levels improved,” said Vitaly Umansky, analyst at the consultancy firm Seaport Research Partners. More than 70 percent of the people who visited the territory in 2024 came from mainland China, whose economic growth reached in 2024 the goal of 5 percent fixed by Beijing. But Nicholas Chen, an analyst at CreditSights, said the group company of financial rating agency Fitch expects a slowdown to 4.7 percent this year, in part due to weak private consumption. The consumer confidence index in China fell to the lowest level in the last 34 years in September, highlighted Jeffrey Kiang, an analyst at consultancy CLSA. In other words, “if the outlook for Chinese consumers is not good, they may tighten their belts, reduce travel and consumption”, including in Macau, explained Nicholas Chen.
Stimulus Policies The Chinese Communist Party has launched a series of stimulus measures, including the reduction of interest rates and mandatory bank reserves and the anticipation of thousands of millions of its budget in 2025 to fund construction projects. Beijing also expanded a consumer goods exchange system and raised the salaries of millions of public servants to revive domestic demand. “The [Chinese] Government has already said that it will launch more measures to stimulate the economy”, said Vitaly Umansky, who hopes above all for a recovery in confidence among the middle class: “I think it will happen, it’s just a matter of time”. Creditsights expects Chinese consumer confidence to rise in the second half of 2025, along with real estate price stabilization, which have been falling for 19 consecutive months. The issue concerns a lot of Beijing, due to the implications for social stability, since housing is one of the main investment vehicles of families and the real estate sector - adding indirect factors - represents about 30 percent of the Chinese economy. “There will certainly be some side effects, because part of the measures that are adopted to boost domestic consumption could flow to the Macau gaming sector”, said Nicholas Chen. The analyst believes that China will also expand the list of cities whose residents can apply for 'individual visas' to visit Hong Kong and Macau, a method used by 35.2 percent of tourists who passed through Macau in 2024.
Different views Vitaly Umansky has no opinion and recalls that since January 1 residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay up to seven days. On the other hand, analysts agree that casino revenues will be far from the historical maximum of 303 billion patacas recorded in 2018 next year. "One thing is clear: the government aims to moderately growth in revenues in the future," said Jeffrey Kiang, recalling authorities predict gaming revenues of 240 billion in 2025, which would be a 5.8 percent increase. . “When the Macau Government publishes a forecast, it is usually very conservative and is based on prior discussion with the Liaison Office” of the Chinese Central Government in the city, said Vitaly Umansky. The analyst does not believe that Beijing has some measure to control the resuming of casinos, similar to the campaign that began with the arrest of the leader of the world's largest VIP betting company in November 2021. The former executive director of Suncity, Alvin Chau Cheok Wa, was sentenced in January 2023 to 18 years in prison for illicit gambling and secret society exploitation, in a case that saw the number of licenses for gambling promoters drop from 85 to 18, known as 'junkets'. “Much of the reprehensible behavior in Macau disappeared with the junkets. As long as things like that don't happen again, I don't expect any kind of campaign in the short term,” said Umansky.

item.title: Traffic | Lawyer calls for an end to “moral judgments” with images
item.description:
The causal Luís Ho Ka considers that the use of traffic chambers can lead to cases in court, and that the images captured must be sent to the authorities, rather than shared on social networks
Lawyer Luís Ho Ka Hou defends the use of surveillance cameras in traffic by drivers, but calls on the Government to take measures to avoid using the images for “moral judgments”. The lawyer's opinion was shared with the newspaper Ou Mun, following an incident in front of the Portuguese School of Macau, in which images of a lawyer of Portuguese nationality were shared. Heard by the newspaper Ou Mun, the lawyer considered that recording videos by cameras installed in vehicles can be important, particularly when there are accidents and the need to activate car insurance. However, Ho Ka Hou highlighted that vehicle cameras cannot be turned into a mobile surveillance system used to make “moral judgments” on social media. Ho also explained that the images captured by the vehicles must be handed over to the authorities, instead of being published online, and that those responsible for the recording must only send them to the authorities, following the legal procedures provided. If the images are of public interest, they can be used. However, if the use of images goes beyond the scope of the authorities' process and investigations, as happens with publications on social networks, and if there are elements that can be considered insulting or defamatory, then the person responsible for capturing and disseminating them may face criminal liability.
Legal problems Luís Ho Ka Hou also indicated that, according to the judicial perspective, the appropriate use of recorded images in traffic is captured the accidents, to hold it and cooperate with the authorities, in case it is necessary to collect evidence. If there is no consent of the recorded people, and if the content is published on social networks for moral judgments, then we are facing cases that are hardly under the appropriate recording, which may lead to violation of the law of personal data protection or other image rights. Ho Ka Hou also warned that “judgments” on social media could cause damage to the rights to privacy and good name of the parties involved. About two weeks ago a driver was captured in traffic, after passing a red light, parking in a forbidden place and making an obscene gesture with children. The images, which allowed the driver to identify, were shared online, which held a campaign against the visa, including with dismissal requests from the employer, as well as several hate comments with xenophobic expressions.

item.title: Hospitality | More than 14.4 million guests in 2024
item.description:
Last year, Macau hotels hosted more than 14.4 million people, with the average room occupancy rate reaching 86.4 percent, an annual increase of almost 5 percent. Room prices in 5-star hotels rose 2.8 percent, with the average night stay standing at 1,585 patacas
The Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) yesterday revealed that last year the hotel establishments of Macau hosted about 14,433,000 people, totaling a 6.4 percent increase with 2023. Statistical data show the significant climb of international customers, which totaled more than 1.1 million, with an annual growth of 57.4 percent. In this chapter highlight to guests from the Republic of Korea, who duplicated annually, and reached the 321 thousand. Also the number of guests of Malaysia (87,000), Japan (81,000), India (73,000) and Singapore (68,000) ascended 53.4, 49.1, 97.2 and 24.1 percent respectively. From a more operational perspective, in 2024 the industry registered an average occupancy rate of 86.4 percent guest rooms, plus 4.9 percentage points compared to 2023. The 5 -star hotels were the ones that recorded the highest occupancy rates Rooms (88.6 percent), with a rise of 6.1 percent. Sides of the medal During 2024, the average price of rooms in five-star hotels was 1,585 patacas, an increase of 2.8 percent compared to 2023, according to data from the Macau Hotel Association, cited by the Tourism Services Bureau. The data reveals that last year's prices were just 0.6 percent below the 2019 record The month of December exceeded the average prices charged throughout 2024, with the average price in 4 and 5 star hotels reaching 1,624 patacas, still a drop of 8.1 percent compared to December 2023. Highlight for Last month completed six consecutive months of year-on-year price drops, a decline that began in July. At the end of last year, there were 146 hotel establishments in Macau that provided accommodation services to the public (+4, compared to the end of 2023), providing a total of 43,000 guest rooms (-7.8 percent).

item.title: Fires | New law leads to the punishment of 83 people
item.description: Since the entry into force of the new fire prevention law in August 2022, 83 people have been punished, yesterday said the commander of the Fire Department (CB), Leong Iok Sam, during the press conference for the disclosure of data last year's work. The official highlighted that “in cases where the situation is serious and the offenders insist [on maintaining the same situation], we apply 83 administrative sanctions after warning them several times”, he said. In 2024, 15,924 inspections were carried out by the CB in residential buildings to identify potential fire risks, or obstacles in access to fire extinguishers or emergency exits. Regarding training, the CB carried out 220 courses with 11,172 people until December last year, in the areas of fire safety managers, a requirement of the new law. Still in relation to fires, the CB commander highlighted the “slight increase” last year. “In 2024 there were 882 cases of fires, an increase of 46 cases, which represents an increase of 5.5 percent compared to 2023.” These incidents occurred due to forgetting to turn off the stove, burning incense and votive papers or short-circuiting electrical installations. In the case of ambulance departures, there was an annual increase of 5.06 percent, from 2,177 cases to 4,523. The main causes were medical issues such as malaise, dizziness or headaches, among others. Leong Iok Sam also said that there are already three vehicles registered for the experimental project “Cross-border Ambulance Transport between Hong Kong and Macau”.

item.title: Traffic | Accidents and fines shoot in 2024
item.description:
Last year ended with more than 15,500 road accidents, an annual increase of 14 percent. Despite the increase in injuries, which exceed 5,300, deaths on the road decreased to five. In 2024, authorities collected almost 190 million patacas in fines, an increase of 9.12 percent, despite infractions only rising 0.4 percent
More road accidents, more patacas in fines and less dead in road accidents. This can summarize 2024, according to the statistical data released by the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP). Last year, the roads and streets of Macau totaled 15,510 car accidents, a total that represented an annual rise of 14.36 percent compared to 2023. Still, 2024 was less deadly on the territory roads, with five fatalities (all related to drivers) against eight deaths recorded in 2023, ie a decrease of 37.5 percent. However, the number of injuries increased by almost 13 percent to a total of 5,341, climb driven by the increase of light injuries in a year when the wounds that needed hospitalization fell almost 50 percent. Still in the accident rate chapter, the highlight is the increase in accidents involving pedestrians, with an annual increase of 6.7 percent to a total of 510 occurrences. Economic diversification The year 2024 was also a period in which the value of fines added almost 16 million patacas compared to the previous year. Last year, the total value of fines was almost 189.8 million patacas, an increase of 9.12 percent compared to the same period last year. Despite the increase in the amount collected by the authorities, violations of the road traffic law and the highway code remained practically the same level, with a slight increase of 0.4 percent to 703.8 thousand occurrences. In terms of fines, parking continued to dominate, with 618,260 fines, the vast majority for illegal parking on public roads. Even so, parking fines decreased by 2.38 percent compared to 2023. However, the number of blocked vehicles increased by 24.5 percent in 2024, to a total of 2,226. At the opposite pole, CPSP's 2024 data reveal the return of a classic, with the climb almost 48 percent of taxi drivers' irregularities for a total of 870 cases. Regarding drivers caught driving under the influence of alcohol, the authorities accounted for 170 drunk people, an annual climb of almost 7 percent. Of these 170 people, 155 were male. One of the statistics that has increased in recent times in terms of fines is pedestrians who cross the road without complying with traffic rules. Last year, authorities fined 7,460 pedestrians, a total that represented an increase of 58.5 percent.

item.title: Zelensky vs Zelensky
item.description:
10/27/22 A renovated Ukrainian, with the same name of the president, guilty Zelensky about the extension of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the village, who has never left his land, now lives mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 In a lunch with several guests I hear a friend, who declares himself a spiritist, explaining about the particularities of his belief, in a serene and balanced way, would even say, without "irrationalism". He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife. — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unambiguous moral implication in the phrase “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is managed to seek a reason for Things abroad to us in the other. It is an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this error. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic awareness has brought a positive impact to greater ecological awareness, but followed with scholastic rigor, it stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than uncomfortable: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that each moment asks of us — but how many will make the distinction, under a Law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will abandon themselves to what is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic awareness, as the Greeks knew, but it also brings agency and the courage of decision. And we cannot give up on this. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: «João loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicidou -If and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ that had not entered the story. » Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Fuxi
item.description: O my friends, companions of these disastrous journeys through countries as old as the stars and the Moon, and as strange as the depths of our wretched souls, what surprises still await us, what secret magics we still have to overcome, what horrors will arise before our dilated pupils of astonishment and terror? Increasingly closer to our precarious existences, howls the monster of war, which threatens to merge humanity once and for all with the earth, incessantly traversed by the squalid specter of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pestilences. Oh damned human, who believes you are superior to Nature itself, but then you reveal yourself, time and time again, incapable of simply ordering your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by fickle anger and are a slave to your own ambition! You are not satisfied with white jade or resplendent gold, there is no treasure that can satisfy your inextinguishable thirst for command over other men, animals and things; for eternal anguish dwells in you; in you the expelled serpents crawl; for you grows, powerful and imposing, the most fertile ivy of Evil! This is perhaps why on the Mount they call the White Deer, where one of the eight immortals on a sacred mount soared through the heavens towards Penglai, lives the fuxi, a bird whose shape resembles that of a rooster, although topped by a human head. What strange copulations, what monstrous embraces, what terrible procedures must have occurred to make the existence of this sinister animal possible? We don't know, but all it takes is for our exhausted mind to dare to come up with an answer, and we soon feel our skin covered in horrendous goosebumps and our heart races in parade, like a wild horse whipped by the night whip of fear, unrestrained by reins and containment. Men should refrain from visiting Monte do Veado, because although there are riches capable of calming the wildest ambitions, if they have the unfortunate luck of catching a glimpse of fuxi, it is certain that a war will soon break out and the fields will perish as a result. cultivated, for it the tame animals will be beheaded, for it the best young men of two generations will be sacrificed and the pride of countries will be destroyed. Fuxi emits a sound that resembles its name. If you hear it, dark night or clear day, goose way, for the path where you find you is the most right of the ways for misfortune!

item.title: Investigators ask the South Korean MP to accuse the deposit leader
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption office yesterday recommended to the Public Prosecutor's Office that deposed President Yoon Suk-yeol be charged with rebellion and abuse of power for declaring martial law in December. The High employee corruption investigation office (CIO) has announced that it has transferred the case to the prosecutor, which has the power to formally accuse a South Korean head of state. The CIO considers that Yoon conspired with the then Minister of National Defense, Kim Yong-hyun, and other military officers to start a mutiny, declaring martial law on the night of December 3rd. It further argues that Yoon abused his power by sending troops to the National Assembly (parliament) to prevent deputies from revoking martial law. The Public Prosecution Service now has 11 days to decide whether or not to start the requested process. If Yoon is considered guilty of leading an insurrection, a crime for which a president has no immunity in the country, he may be sentenced to life imprisonment or the death penalty. Yoon is in custody at the Seoul Detention Center in Uiwang, south of Seoul, since January 15. The Constitutional Court is simultaneously made a judgment to determine whether or not to ratify the dismissal approved by parliamentarians on December 14. If the highest court in South Korea confirms the impeachment, early presidential elections have to be called within 60 days after the court decision. Yoon refuses to witness in the investigation into the alleged crime of rebellion. Yoon Suk-Youol surprised the country on December 3 by declaring martial law, a measure reminiscent of black days of the South Korean military dictatorship and that justified with the intention of protecting the country from “North Korean Communist forces” and “Eliminate elements hostile to the state”. Pressured by the deputies and thousands of protesters, Yoon was forced to revoke the decision hours later.

item.title: Afghanistan | Beijing calls for severe punishment for authors of the murder of Chinese citizen
item.description: China yesterday appealed to the Afghan authorities to do an "exhaustive investigation" and "severely punish" those responsible for the murder on Wednesday of a Chinese citizen who worked on a gold mine in Takhar's Afghan province. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said at a press conference yesterday that Beijing is “deeply shocked” by the attack. “China is against all forms of terrorism”, stressed the spokesperson, calling for “the repression of the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations listed by the UN Security Council”. "China will continue to pay close attention to the security situation in Afghanistan and to support Afghan authorities in combating all forms of terrorist violence and maintaining security and stability in the country," Mao added, urging the Afghan government to Take the necessary measures "to ensure the safety of citizens and Chinese organizations in the country." According to local police, the victim worked in a gold mine in the region, which borders Tajiquistan. A local branch of the Islamic State Islamic Group claimed the authorship of the attack. China is one of the few international actors that has maintained diplomatic relations with Afghanistan since the Taliban reached power in August 2021. The two countries share a small international border of just 76 kilometers in the easternmost part of the so-called Wajan Corridor, a remote pass in the Pamir mountain range. Chinese companies, with the support of Beijing, have sought to take advantage of opportunities to explore the vast deposits of non -developed resources from Afghanistan, especially Mes Aynak Mine, which is believed to contain the largest copper deposit in the world.

item.title: Commerce | Beijing says tariffs do not benefit China, US or the world
item.description: The Chinese Ministry of Trade said yesterday that the United States imposition of customs of Chinese goods “would not benefit China, the United States or the world,” in the face of the threats of US leader Donald Trump. The ministry's spokesman, He Yadong, said at a press conference that his country “has always maintained a consistent position” on increasing rates. “China is willing to work with the US to put economic and trade relations between the two countries in a stable, healthy and sustainable direction,” he said. Asked whether his ministry has already communicated with the new US administration's commercial team, He said that China “always maintains contact with the competent authorities” in the United States. Chinese diplomats assured on Wednesday that “there are no winners in a trade war”, after Trump said he was considering imposing 10 percent duties on Chinese imports in retaliation for the flow of fentanyl. “We're talking about a 10 percent rate based on the fact that they're shipping fentanyl to Mexico and Canada,” Trump told reporters at the White House on Tuesday. The Republican leader said that he spoke “the other day” with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, and that he told him that he did not want that “crap” in the country. Last year, around 70,000 deaths were recorded in the United States due to the consumption of that synthetic opioid. Trump team members included China on Monday, along with Canada and Mexico, among countries whose US commercial relationship would be revised by the Republican, which launched a trade war against the Asian nation during its first term.

item.title: Beijing orders funds to buy more shares to boost markets
item.description: The Chinese Government announced yesterday that it will order pension and investment funds to buy more shares in Chinese companies, aiming to stimulate the country's financial markets, after years of stagnation. Officials said that starting this year, mutual funds must increase their holdings in domestic shares, called A shares, by at least 10 percent per year for the next three years. Commercial insurance funds will have to invest 30 percent of their new annual awards in the actions of action starting this year, they added. "This means that at least several hundred thousand long -term yuan millions of yuan will be added [to the shareholder market] every year," said Wu Qing, chairman of China's Securities Regulatory Committee. “The implementation of the various measures of the plan will further increase the capital's capital funds' capital affectation capacity, constantly expand the scale of investment, improve the supply and structure of funds in the capital market and consolidate the good conditions to The recovery of the capital market, ”he explained. The Chinese Communist Party announced this measure just before the biggest holiday of the year in China, the Lunar New Year, which begins on Wednesday, January 29. It is a time when families tend to increase spending on meals, travel and cash gifts for adult children and young people. Hong Kong and Shanghai markets climbed after the announcement, with the Shanghai Index composite initially winning about 1.5 percent, although in the middle of the session it was rising 0.8 percent. Hang Seng Kong's Hang Seng Index lost its first gains and remained virtually unchanged. Chinese stock markets reached their peak value before the Asian financial crisis and have since remained well below that level. The lack of appreciation in stock prices, together with falling property prices, has diminished investor confidence, raising deflationary risks in the world's second largest economy. Advances and Reforms To date, Chinese government efforts to make people spend more and save less have been mitigating success. An initiative to promote the purchase of energetically efficient vehicles and appliances through the payment of subsidies to consumers who deliver old versions of these articles increased sales. But action prices stopped after a brief recovery at the end of last year. Wu said that pension funds will be forced to overhaul the way they evaluate their performance and that companies will be encouraged to carry out more share buybacks and pay higher dividends to provide shareholders with better returns. “This is a very important institutional advance for the entry of medium and long term funds in the market. It can be said that it solves a problem that has been solved for many years, ”he added. "Sales of the main shareholders and the high market volatility have impaired Chinese financial squares," said Law Meng, Chinese action analyst at UBS Securities, in a comment widespread yesterday. “The desire of long-term investors to participate in the stock market has decreased,” he added. “The proposal to reform market value management directly addresses this issue, because it is directly related to investors’ sense of gain”, he highlighted.

item.title: Ukraine | Beijing and Brasilia highlight “growing consensus” to find political solution
item.description:
The two nations continue to make efforts to find a solution that puts an end to the conflict in Ukraine. Wang Yi and Celso Amorim spoke on the phone yesterday
Chinese diplomacy chief Wang Yi yesterday highlighted the “growing consensus of all parts to promote a political solution” for the war in Ukraine during a telephone conversation with Brazilian special counselor Celso Amorim. In 2024 Wang and Amorim advanced with a joint proposal to end the conflict between Russia and Ukraine. "The goal is to gather the consensus of the" global south "and create and accumulate conditions for peace conversations," said Wang Yi yesterday, according to a statement issued by the Chinese Foreign Ministry. Wang stated that China and Brazil have “similar development trajectories and highly complementary economies” and that the “strong mutual trust and friendship established between the heads of state of the two countries have laid a solid political foundation for both to carry out cooperation comprehensive”. “China firmly supports the leadership of the Brazilian President, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, so that the Brazilian people explore a path of development, in accordance with their national conditions”, added the minister, while at the same time conveying his “support ” to the South American country during its current presidency of the BRICS bloc of emerging countries. Wang also expressed his hope to “work with Brazil to defend genuine multilateralism”. Amorim called for efforts to “build a community of common destiny between Brazil and China for a fairer world and a more sustainable planet”. “Brazil and China, as emerging powers, can further strengthen cooperation and play a greater role in maintaining world peace and combating climate change,” stated the special advisor to the Brazilian Presidency. Preferred friend According to official data, China has been Brazil's largest trading partner since 2008. The Chinese market was the destination for 30 percent of Brazilian exports in 2023, when sales to the Asian country totaled 104 billion dollars, mostly made up for food products and raw materials. China, in turn, maintains investments in Brazil of about $ 40 billion, which in recent years have been applied in the energy sector.

item.title: Davos | Beijing warns of “unimaginable” consequences of dividing the world
item.description: Chinese vice-master-master, Ding Xuexiang, warned yesterday at the World Economic Forum in Davos, to the dangers of a possible division of the world into two separate systems, warning that the consequences would be “unimaginable” and would severely impair humanity. In speaking in the Swiss city, Ding stressed that the international community is increasingly concerned with this risk, since “it would be very difficult to face common challenges,” including climate change, food safety and energy transition, ““ If the world is divided. ” The Chinese leader warned of the risks of confrontation in the "worst scenario", a situation where "no country could be indifferent." "Davos remains a fundamental forum for discussing global issues and fostering international cooperation, promoting new ideas for common progress," he said. Ding also appealed to global solidarity, stressing that international cooperation is essential to overcome turbulence and building a common future. According to the ruler, China has been a firm defender of multilateralism and is still committed to the law -based international system, with the UN as a center. The deputy prime minister highlighted his country's commitment to building inclusive economic globalization, noting that, despite “divergences regarding its distribution”, this continues to be a “win-win” trend. China is a “defender and builder” of the international order, he assured.
